reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had 2 nights there, in a 2 queen bed room. The size was very good - about 300 SF. It was clean and the beds were comfortable. People were friendly. It was mostly quiet. The muffins were delicious. There was mild 'fraying around the edges' of the furniture, bathroom, and paint, but overall, it was a good choice.
reviews.title: very good for a motel

reviews.text: Friendly,clean and great coffee and cake with fresh fruit in the morning. The location of the rooms are conveniently across from police and Fire houses. The rates are affordable. Mark also has maps and pamphlets for guests that want to see the wonderful sites of New Hampshire. I would definitely return next year.
reviews.title: Hospitality and clean

reviews.text: We needed a place to stay last minute. It was a great value for the price. The motel is antiquated but well maintained. Large room-beds were comfortable- ac and fridge worked great- the home made muffins were excellent and the owner was very personable..
reviews.title: Convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great place, great price, great dog and Mark the owner! Knows the area and places to visit and eat! Try Buckie's for dinner! Coffee and soda free! Easy to find and in between the lake region! Bath towels were soft and thick!
reviews.title: K & M

reviews.text: Mark is great, and his new dog is just so friendly. It isn't often when a motel provides fresh baked blueberry muffins for breakfast, along with really good fresh-brewed coffee. We wouldn't stay anywhere else in the area! This was our 3rd visit!
reviews.title: Great place to stay!
